chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
server: nid
clients: seq nid
Hnin: is_true (server \notin clients)
Huniq: is_true (uniq clients)
n: Equality.sort nat_eqType

Goal:
n \in clients -> (n == server) = false

Premises:
uniq = fun T : eqType => fix uniq (s : seq T) : bool := match s with | [::] => true | x :: s' => (x \notin s') && uniq s' end : forall T : eqType, seq T -> bool Arguments uniq {T} _%seq_scope
Notation seq := list
Module Equality := Struct Definition block : forall A : Type, A -> A. Parameter JMeq_eq_refl : forall (A : Type) (x : A), JMeq_eq JMeq_refl = erefl x. Parameter UIP_refl_refl : forall (A : Type) (x : A), UIP_refl A x (erefl x) = erefl (erefl x). Parameter inj_pairT2_refl : forall (A : Type) (x : A) (P : A -> Type) (p : P x), inj_pairT2 A P x p p (erefl (existT P x p)) = erefl p. Record DependentEliminationPackage (A : Type) : Type := Build_DependentEliminationPackage { elim_type : Type; elim : elim_type } Definition elim_type : forall A : Type, DependentEliminationPackage A -> Type. Definition elim : forall (A : Type)
sort : forall T : Type, rel T -> seq T -> seq T
is_true = eq^~ true : bool -> Prop Arguments is_true _%bool_scope is_true is a coercion
Record protocol : Type := Protocol { nodes : dstatelet -> pred nid; plab : Ordered.sort Label; coh : cohpred nodes; snd_trans : seq (send_trans coh); rcv_trans : seq (receive_trans coh); snd_uniq : is_true (uniq (Protocols.snd_tags snd_trans)); rcv_uniq : is_true (uniq (Protocols.rcv_tags rcv_trans)) } Arguments Protocols.Protocol [nodes]%function_scope _ [coh] [snd_trans rcv_trans]%seq_scope
addn0 = fun n : nat => [eta eqP] ((fun _evar_0_ : (fun n0 : nat => is_true (n0 + 0 == n0)) 0 => (nat_ind (fun n0 : nat => n0 + 0 == n0) _evar_0_)^~ n) (eqxx 0) (fun n0 : nat => id)) : right_id 0 addn
leqn0 : forall n : nat, (n <= 0) = (n == 0)
div.eqn_div : forall (d m : nat) (n : nat_eqType), 0 < d -> div.dvdn d m -> (n == div.divn m d) = (n * d == m)
eqn0Ngt : forall n : nat_eqType, (n == 0) = ~~ (0 < n)
Equality.sort = fun t : eqType => let (sort, _) := t in sort : eqType -> Type Equality.sort is a coercion
nat_eqType = EqType nat nat_eqMixin : eqType
subnKC : forall m n : nat, m <= n -> m + (n - m) = n
bigop.index_iota = fun m n : nat => iota m (n - m) : nat -> nat -> seq nat Arguments bigop.index_iota (_ _)%nat_scope
rot = fun (T : Type) (n : nat) (s : seq T) => drop n s ++ take n s : forall T : Type, nat -> seq T -> seq T Arguments rot {T}%type_scope _%nat_scope _%seq_scope
subSn : forall m n : nat, m <= n -> n.+1 - m = (n - m).+1
all_hooks_fire = fun (h : hooks) (l : Label) (st : nat_ordType) (s : union_mapUMC Label dstatelet) (n : nid) (msg : seq nat) (to : nid) => forall (z : nat_ordType) (lc : Label) (hk : hook_type), Some hk = find (z, lc, (l, st)) h -> lc \in dom s -> l \in dom s -> hk (getLocal n (getStatelet s lc)) (getLocal n (getStatelet s l)) msg to : hooks -> Label -> nat_ordType -> union_mapUMC Label dstatelet -> nid -> seq nat -> nid -> Prop Arguments all_hooks_fire _ _ _ _ _ _%seq_scope
leq = fun m n : nat => m - n == 0 : nat -> nat -> bool Arguments leq (_ _)%nat_scope
in_cons : forall (T : eqType) (y : T) (s : seq T) (x : T), (x \in y :: s) = (x == y) || (x \in s)
div.eqn_dvd : forall m n : nat_eqType, (m == n) = div.dvdn m n && div.dvdn n m
eqn_leq : forall m n : nat_eqType, (m == n) = (m <= n <= m)
mulnbl : forall (b : bool) (n : nat), b * n = (if b then n else 0)
leqNgt : forall m n : nat, (m <= n) = ~~ (n < m)
ltnNge : forall m n : nat, (m < n) = ~~ (n <= m)
getLocal = fun (n : nid) (d : dstatelet) => match find n (dstate d) with | Some h => h | None => Unit end : nid -> dstatelet -> heap
locU : forall (n n' : nat_eqType) (x : heap) (st : union_map_classPCM (union_mapUMC nat_ordType heap)) (s : soup), n != n' -> valid st -> getLocal n {| dstate := upd n' x st; dsoup := s |} = getLocal n {| dstate := st; dsoup := s |}
uniq_size_uniq : forall (T : eqType) (s1 s2 : seq T), uniq s1 -> s1 =i s2 -> uniq s2 = (size s2 == size s1)
leq_eqVlt : forall m n : nat, (m <= n) = (m == n) || (m < n)
nseq = fun (T : Type) (n : nat) => (ncons n)^~ [::] : forall T : Type, nat -> T -> seq T Arguments nseq {T}%type_scope _%nat_scope
Actions.step_other : forall (W : world) (this : nid) (V : Type) (a : Actions.action W V this) (l : Label) (s1 s2 : state) (r : V) (n : nat_eqType) (pf : Actions.a_safe a s1), this != n -> Actions.a_step pf s2 r -> getLocal n (getStatelet s1 l) = getLocal n (getStatelet s2 l)
a_step_other : forall (W : world) (this : nid) (V : Type) (a : Actions.action W V this) (l : Label) (s1 s2 : state) (r : V) (n : nat_eqType) (pf : Actions.a_safe a s1), this != n -> Actions.a_step pf s2 r -> getLocal n (getStatelet s1 l) = getLocal n (getStatelet s2 l)
eqn_pmul2r : forall m n1 n2 : nat, 0 < m -> (n1 * m == n2 * m) = (n1 == n2)
leqP : forall m n : nat, leq_xor_gtn m n (m <= n) (n < m)
count_uniq_mem : forall (T : eqType) (s : seq T) (x : T), uniq s -> count_mem x s = (x \in s)
perm_eq = fun (T : eqType) (s1 s2 : seq T) => all [pred x | count_mem x s1 == count_mem x s2] (s1 ++ s2) : forall T : eqType, seq T -> seq T -> bool Arguments perm_eq {T} (_ _)%seq_scope
